instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_ACOK: What is CHGR_ACOK? This is identical to SMC_BC_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I have a 2010 macbook pro with an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b mother board and it wont turn on, I am getting a very dim green light on the charger and have traced the problem back to the acok circuit, I get all the correct voltages up to pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>. I get 17.09 volts on pin one but 0 on pin 2, <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR> is giving the correct resistance at 30.1k ohms, but <RESISTOR>R7011</RESISTOR> gives .5 ohms on the board and the correct 9.3k ohms off the board, I have no idea why Im getting the wrong value when on the board. While the resistor is off I get infinite resistance between 1 and 2 as expected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Measure in diode mode red probe to ground and black probe to F7040, this seems to be a bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Check value for <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>.... Still think it is a bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>......  Also, try known good magsafe....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 268 ohms on <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, 10 ohms on 7021 10 ohms on <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i have tried a working magsafe and still got the same dim green light on the charger a while ago but i didnt do any measurements with it, i can get it back if needed

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Ok, <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is bad, should be 20 ohms, so <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> is bad too, replace both....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b  not getting <SIGNAL>CHGR_ACOK</SIGNAL>
threads.message: okay will do, thanks a lot

threads.message: This happened because of a bad charger, do not use the one that caused this again.
